abstract: Republican lawmakers agree to support legislation to help Veterans Affairs Dept cover $2.5 billion budget gap; shortfall had threatened to medical care for large number of patients in coming months; funds will be diverted from 'Choice Card,' Republican-backed initiative that allows certain veterans to choose taxpayer-paid care outside health system.
lead_paragraph: A plan for legislation to allow the Department of Veterans Affairs to shift money to fill a budget shortfall, which threatens health care for patients, wins support from Republican lawmakers.

headline.main: Lawmakers Agree to Help Veterans Agency Fill a Budget Gap
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Agree to Help Veterans Agency Fill a Budget Gap

snippet: A plan for legislation to allow the Department of Veterans Affairs to shift money to fill a budget shortfall, which threatens health care for patients, wins support from Republican lawmakers.
